bill_title: to require a school district to obligate all money in its special education fund before it may receive money for extraordinary expenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a school district to obligate all money in its special education fund before it may receive money for extraordinary expenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-37 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A school district is not eligible for the funding from money set aside in § § 13-37-38 to 13- 37-40, inclusive, if the district has any unobligated funds in its special education fund at the end of the previous fiscal year. Section 2. That section 4 of chapter 108 of the 1996 Session Laws be repealed. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
